Description: Rim sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: reserved band at top, glazed black below; at bottom of sherd, reserved band and remains of black at top of wall; exterior: black band on top and part of outside of rim, reserved below; inscription on exterior.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B2 (possibly)
Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B3 (possibly)
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer identifies the sherd as coming from a Type 9B or Type 9C South Ionian cup with everted rim. Type 9C correspond to Attic Siana or Gordion cups and find parallels with Hayes' Ionian Cup Type X (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116) and Vallet and Villard's Ionian Cup type B3 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88) Type 9B cups closely follow the shape and decoration of the Attic Plain Komast cups. These cups coincide with Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type IX (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116) and Villard’s Ionian Cup Type B2 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). Type 9 cups have been found in large numbers in other sanctuary settings including at the Sanctuary of Demeter and Kore at Tocra, and at the site of Megara Hyblaea on Sicily. This type was the most common type of South Ionian cups with everted rims found at Naukratis. The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape.
The treatment of the lower lip inside is unusual.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 715, no. 732)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 52, no. 252)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.671) (Phase 3)
